lines.text: I've always sort of wanted to be the bad girl...
Impossible. But I'll tell you something. You sure have wasted an incredible pair of hooters.
We tried to figure where to take you last night, but you kept saying, "Why, oh, why, oh, why, oh did I ever leave Ohio?"
That's a damn good question.
You're asking me if I, Dick Dale, can play Venus?
Yes.
No.

[at the bar]
Gimme another one, Little Buddy.
Don't call me that. I *hate* that!
What does that mean, "we're not in?"
Wild guess? I think it means they're not in.
Boy, it's quite a piece of dialogue when you intellectual masterminds get together! I should be writing this down!

[after his dad's overdone sentimentality has induced mass vomiting throughout the plane]
This is why we don't travel.
But what does "we" mean?

[impossibly sarcastic]
I think it's the plural form, meaning "more than one." Would you like me to conjugate that for you, Pop? Do you know what "conjugate" means, Dad?

Hey, they serve a drink here called the stunned mallet and serve it in a coconut shell. You know, I once saw a woman drink one of these, get completely naked, and do 'the Pony'... right on this table.
And your point is?
My point is I want to buy you... two of them.
We've got to shove off, little buddy.
Oh no, not you! Not now!
I'm sorry. It's time to go. We'll be back real soon; it's only a three-hour tour.
It's *NEVER* a three-hour tour!
You can tell the men from the boys by the price of their toys.
Did you boys have a nice time?
We met these really weird looking guys with really bad attitudes and they were incredibly rude and dangerous and they wanted to kill us! It was so cool!
Well, as long as you had fun.
You look familiar. Have we met?
I don't think so. I've been away for a long time.
Where? Prison?
No, worse then that. A tropical island in the Pacific. There were chicks there, but you couldn't touch them. Wanna hear about it?
No!

You know, I lived with a guy for years. A real genius. He could take a couple of these pineapples or a couple of coconuts with some strings and wire and make a nuclear reactor. But he couldn't fix a two-foot hole in a boat. Wanna hear the rest?
No!
Maybe the Midwest is for me.
Where's the movie stars? I thought L.A. was supposed to have movie stars, rock and rollers, celebrities.
Oh honey, that's what all midwesterners think. L.A. is just like any other place.
[Annette goes to pick up her suitcase from the luggage rack when O.J. Simpson appears and takes the suitcase first]
Excuse me, ma'am but I do believe this is my bag.
Oh, I'm sorry. Of course it is. My is leatherette and this seems to be...
Pigskin. Thank you very much.
[runs off]
Hey, Mom! Do you know who that was?
No, honey. Who?
What was...
[in the distance Simpson trips and falls into a pile of suitcases]
Nah. I guess I was wrong.
[last lines]
Are we the corniest couple you've ever seen or what?

[into a phone]
Mountain's Lodge. Hold on. Hey, Webby! Your mom's on the phone!

[as he runs out]
I can't talk now! Tell her I gotta surf!

[into the phone]
Sorry, ma'am, uh... he's dead.
[hangs up]
I thought I saw a thing, but I don't know what thing I saw.
You're supposed to know what it means when I burn stuff!
He'll be back. I know that in my heart.
You know, you're awful sweet, Mom.
And then I'll make him suffer.
[first lines]

45 years ago, my parents were the most popular teenagers in America. It's true. My dad was a teen idol. Girls threw themselves at him. Unfortunately, this was 1962 and he had to throw them back. When Dad wasn't singing he spent his time on a surfboard. They called him The Big Kahuna. When I was born, Dad wanted to call me Little Kahuna. Luckily, he settled for Bobby. As for Mom, she joined that stupid cult club called the Mouseketeers. She became the first pin-up queen for boys under 12. Anyhow, they got married and moved to Ohio right after the accident. Don't get him started on the surf accident. We have this nightly ritual called dinner and the accident story. Let me spare you this... 20 years ago while surfing this huge wave knocked the Kahuna right off his board and he's never been the same since.
